text: The Filmfare East Best Female Playback Singer Award is given by Indian film magazine Filmfare as a part of its annual Filmfare Awards for Bengali films, to recognise a female playback singer who has delivered an outstanding performance in a film song. ==Superlatives== {| class="wikitable" |+ |- ! Superlative ! Artist ! Record |- |Most awards |Anwesha Datta Gupta, Iman Chakraborty, Chandrani Banerjee |1 |- |Most nominations |Shreya Ghoshal |5 |- |Most consecutive wins | | |- |Most nominations without ever winning |Shreya Ghoshal |5 |- |Most nominations in a single year |Shreya Ghoshal (2017) |3 |- |Oldest winner |Iman Chakraborty (2017) |27 |- |Oldest nominee |Shreya Ghoshal (2018) |33 |- |Youngest winner |Anwesha Datta Gupta |20 |- |Youngest nominee |Anwesha Datta Gupta |20 |} Anwesha Datta Gupta was the first holder of this award back in 2014 for the song "Saradin Aar Sara Raat" from Rupkotha Noy. Iman Chakraborty won the award on the second edition in 2017. Shreya Ghoshal holds the record for most nominations (5), Oldest nominee. Shreya Ghoshal also holds the record for most nominations without ever winning (5). Both Anwesha Datta Gupta, Iman Chakraborty and Chandrani Banerjee have won the award one time. ===Most Wins=== {| class="sortable wikitable" |- ! Winner ! Number of wins !
